articles.author: Aisha Malik, Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Unlisted connects homeowners with prospective buyers before they even put their homes up for sale and is part of TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.description: Unlisted is like Zillow but for homes that are not yet on the market. The company is now launching an iOS app.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: Super Teacher is building an AI tutor for elementary schools — catch it at Disrupt 2025
articles.description: Super Teacher’s app features animated tutors with AI-generated voices that guide students through interactive lessons. Students talk to the app using
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: Mappa’s AI voice analysis helps you find the best job candidates and will show off its tech at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.description: Mappa's AI hiring platform can assess a candidate's behavior based on voice patterns, and aims to take some of the guesswork out of hiring.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: Inside CampusAI’s mission to close the AI training gap for everyday workers — check it out at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.description: CampusAI is an educational platform focused on making learning accessible to everyday people who want to bring AI into their everyday workflows, and
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Unthread has a plan for cleaning up Slack and will show off its tech at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.description: Unthread builds Slack-native, AI-powered support bots for high-profile customers like Intuit, Lemonade, and Automattic.
articles.author: Russell Brandom

articles.title: Khosla-backed Mazama taps super-hot rocks in race to deliver 24/7 power
articles.description: Geothermal startup Mazama Energy said it drilled a borehole that set a temperature record. Such superhot rocks could make geothermal a key player in
articles.author: Tim De Chant

articles.title: Aurora expands self-driving trucks route to El Paso
articles.description: Aurora's first driverless route was from Dallas to Houston. This next one is Fort Worth to El Paso.
articles.author: Kirsten Korosec

articles.title: Mirror’s founder is back with a new ‘connected screen’ startup: a gaming device called ‘Board’
articles.description: Mirror's founder is back with a connected gaming startup called Board that combines board games and video games.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Netflix CTO says more vertical video experiments are coming, but streamer is not competing with TikTok
articles.description: Netflix CTO Elizabeth Stone says company is experimenting with vertical video, but isn't trying to be TikTok.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Netflix launches redesigned profiles for kids
articles.description: Netflix announces new Kids' profiles with real-time recommendations, a "My Netflix" hub, and more.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Netflix CTO announces interactive real-time voting for live content
articles.description: While watching live content, viewers will be able to vote to directly influence the outcome of what they're watching on their TV or mobile device.
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: Sam Altman says OpenAI will have a ‘legitimate AI researcher’ by 2028
articles.description: To achieve those goals, OpenAI is betting on two key strategies: continued algorithmic innovation and dramatically scaling up "test time compute" —
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Charter Space brings fintech to spacecraft insurance and is showing off its stuff at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.description: The goal is faster, cheaper, and more reliable risk evaluation for spacecraft insurance, and eventually to power new forms of credit and nondilutive
articles.author: Aria Alamalhodaei

articles.title: CyDeploy wants to create a replica of a company’s system to help it test updates before pushing them out — catch it at Disrupt 2025

articles.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai

articles.title: Venture capital is not an asset class, says Sequoia’s Roelof Botha
articles.description: Sequoia's managing partner Roelof Botha noted that there are currently 3,000 venture firms in the United States, while there were just 1,000 when he
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: CEO of Alphabet’s X, Astro Teller, on what makes a moonshot
articles.description: Teller says X has a 2% hit rate, which means that most of the things the company tries don't work out, and that's okay.
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan says AI will shorten our workweek
articles.description: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan says that, in a few years, we should be working a 3-4 day workweek because of AI.
articles.author: Sarah Perez
